newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM reaches wage deal with unions.
newsitem.headline: KLM reaches wage deal with unions.

text.p: Dutch flag carrier KLM Royal Dutch Airlines said on Saturday it had reached an agreement with unions on a wage deal with ground and air staff, which will run until July 1998.
"We have reached an agreement which will last for 15 months, a KLM spokesman said.

The deal gives all staff a 0.75 percent pay rise from the beginning of July this year and a further one percent from the start of 1998. In addition, there is one-off payment equal to 0.75 percent of salaries in October this year.

The agreement comes ahead of KLM's full-year results which are due on Wednesday. Analysts are predicting profits will be sharply undermined by high fuel costs and a hefty wage bill. --Amsterdam Newsrom +31 20 504 5000
